reviews.title: Would not recommend
reviews.text: Brandon house hotel looks impressive when you drive up to the building. The owners have renovated the building but it would appear on a tight budget. Some areas are lovely, like the front lounge where you will find a crackling log fire and comfy stylish seating.The dining room is vast and airy. I found the room very basic, clean but not much money spent on it. The building was very old and quirky which i liked but something was lacking. There was no telephone in the room which i found odd, and the hotel was not staffed between 11pm and 7am.

reviews.title: Vegan Freddie
reviews.text: Unfortunately whe we arrived to our room at approximately 6pm there was very loud music coming from somewhere, we assumed it was the person next door with a music channel on their tv. Slighly annoyed we ignored it and went out for dinner (outside the hotel) and returned later to peace and quiet. However at 7.30am the music struck up again and woke us up, not ideal if like us you came away from home for a relaxing break! When we went down for breakfast we realised the music was actually coming from the kitchen, which was not good! The kitchen was underneath our room.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for two nights, we found the hotel quite easy, no problems there. The staff were lovely and very helpful as especially as I have vegan dietary requirement, they went out off there way to make sure that the breakfast and evening meals were catered for. however the rooms at the front are very noisy due to heavy traffic the next time I book I will request a room at the back.

reviews.title: Great hospitality
reviews.text: Warm, comfortable room with complimentary tea & coffee. Large bathroom and lovely bed. Breakfast was excellent, very tasty. Friendly service and wi-fi that worked. Result!

reviews.title: Lovely stay - old fashioned hospitality
reviews.text: Would definitely use as a stopover en route to Norfolk again.
My room in on the annex area.
reviews.title: Not so great.

reviews.text: The room was VERY noisy from a very busy road, there seems to be no sound insulation at all.
reviews.title: Lunch for 20 people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn’t eat in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Essex Movers

reviews.text: The Breakfast wasn’t great, with wrong items being served, most tables in the breakfast area needed cleaning and the table i was at had sticky surface. It just wanted a good clean!!
reviews.title: Great for families!

reviews.text: Staff seem to be to busy talking to each other rather that looking after their guests!
reviews.title: Brandon house hotel-Great place to stay

reviews.text: We took a group of 15 retired people for a birdwatching holiday on the Suffolk-Norfolk border, staying for three nights. We negotiated good prices, especially for single people wanting their own room. Rooms were large and comfortable and the whole place was very clean. Food was very good. We ordered dinner on arrival so it was ready for us when we sat down later. All the food is fresh cooked but that didn't seem to slow things noticeably on other nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. Good car park. Large lounge made it easy for the group to meet in the evenings.
reviews.title: Good for groups

reviews.text: Only adverse comment in 4 days was that the people on the front of the building had noticed traffic noise one night. The lack of a lift should be noted by older people.
reviews.title: Not as grand as it appears, but Ok

reviews.text: Would recommend this place as a good base for groups exploring the area.
reviews.title: Generally good with a few downsides

reviews.text: A grand building, with ample parking. Easy check in and out. Breakfast was good and proper.
reviews.title: Comfortable, well furnished, minor niggles but overall very good

reviews.text: Room was adequate, no markings on hot and cold in the shower so that was fun. Bed was good and comfortable. Soundproofing between bathrooms was a little to be desired. Room size was very good. (room 109) with two windows, one either end. Not sure about all the waist high Mirrors, whats that all about? Room was warm and comfortable.
reviews.title: Brandon House

reviews.text: Extremely helpful reception staff, immaculately clean, beautiful, big , bright and airy room. We really enjoyed our one night stay here last Friday with our four year old son. Our room was quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and appetisingly presented and the manager was a very helpful and friendly chap.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.text: Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it or stay again, ideal for trips to the beautiful Thetford forest.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.text: My wife and I and a couple of friends stayed here for 1 night to visit RSPB Lakenheath Nature Reserve which is about 5 miles away.
reviews.title: A Friendly place to stay

reviews.text: On arrival we were given a warm welcome and given a review of where everything was.
reviews.title: A comfortable, pleasant stay

reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor overlooking the front of the hotel. It was a spacious room with a double bed. There was a large flat screened TV and wardrobe. Tea and coffee making facilities were included.
reviews.title: Nice Place
